abstract.para: This is SUSE Linux Enterprise Server for SAP Applications (&s4s;).
Manuals can be found in the docu directory of the installation media for &s4s;. Any documentation (if installed) can be found in the /usr/share/doc/ directory of the installed system.

section.title: Features and Versions
section.para: This section includes an overview of some of the major features provided by &s4s;.

section.title: Support Statement for &s4s;
section.para: Support requires an appropriate subscription from SUSE; for more information, see: .

listitem.para: L1: Installation and problem determination - technical support designed to provide compatibility information, installation and configuration assistance, usage support, on-going maintenance and basic troubleshooting. Level 1 Support is not intended to correct product defect errors.

L2: Reproduction of problem isolation - technical support designed to duplicate customer problems, isolate problem areas and potential issues, and provide resolution for problems not resolved by Level 1 Support.

L3: Code Debugging and problem resolution - technical support designed to resolve complex problems by engaging engineering in patch provision, resolution of product defects which have been identified by Level 2 Support.

section.para: SUSE will only support the usage of original (unchanged or not recompiled) packages.

section.title: How to Obtain Source Code
section.para: This SUSE product includes materials licensed to SUSE under the GNU General Public License (GPL). The GPL requires SUSE to provide the source code that corresponds to the GPL-licensed material. The source code is available for download at . Also, for up to three years after distribution of the SUSE product, upon request, SUSE will mail a copy of the source code. Requests should be sent by e-mail to or as otherwise instructed at . SUSE may charge a reasonable fee to recover distribution costs.

section.title: More Information and Feedback

listitem.para: Read the READMEs on the CDs.
Get detailed changelog information about a particular package from the RPM:
<FILENAME>. is the name of the RPM.
Check the ChangeLog file in the top level of CD1 for a chronological log of all changes made to the updated packages.
Find more information in the docu directory of CD1 of the &s4s; CDs. This directory includes a PDF version of the &s4s-guide;.
contains additional or updated documentation for &s4s;.
Visit for the latest product news from SUSE and for additional information on the source code of &sle; products.

section.para: Thanks for using &s4s; in your business.
